result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher Michael Hetzel

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Christopher Michael Hetzel in court.  Attorney Michael F. Hart in court for Christopher Michael Hetzel.  Attorney Mallory R Davis in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Scheduling conference held. Defense counsel requests a bail/bond hearing. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Christopher Michael Hetzel appeared by video.  Attorney Morgan Minter for Michael F. Hart appeared by video for Christopher Michael Hetzel.  Attorney Mallory R Davis in court for State of Wisconsin.
Scheduling conference held. Defense counsel has discovery and requests an additional scheduling conference. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Christopher Michael Hetzel appeared by video.  Attorney Morgan Minter appeared on behalf of Michael F. Hart by video for Christopher Michael Hetzel.  Prosecuting attorney Ryan Jay Michaels appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: City of South Milwaukee police investigator Matthew Kramer. State rests.  Defense rests. Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Original information received and filed; defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty. Case is adjourned to Branch 29.
Scheduling conference scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 078008,
Payable Number: 1026072,
Receipt Number: 22RP032759,
Amount: $20.00

Court ordered no contact with EH and OH and Mary G.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 1 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.

Defendant Christopher Michael Hetzel in court with attorney Michael F. Hart.  Defendant Christopher Michael Hetzel in custody.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer Branch 29.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
